meanings.definition: The part of the alimentary canal that connects the throat to the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The oesophagus helps move food from the throat to the stomach.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can examine the oesophagus using special cameras.
meanings.sent3: The oesophagus decided to take a break from its food-moving duties.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter traveled down his oesophagus, warming his heart.
meanings.sent5: The oesophagus, like a slippery slide, sends food on its way to the stomach.

meanings.definition: A muscular tube through which food passes from the pharynx to the stomach.
meanings.sent1: Food travels smoothly through the oesophagus to reach the stomach.
meanings.sent2: Chewing food well helps the oesophagus in its job of digestion.
meanings.sent3: The oesophagus flexed its muscles to impress the other digestive organs.
meanings.sent4: Her words slid down his oesophagus, leaving a bitter taste in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The oesophagus, a strong tube, ensures food reaches its destination without delay.
